title: Indonesia tries to downplay stabbing of security minister
text:
Jakarta | The Indonesian government has moved to hose down fears the Muslim-majority country is set for a new wave of terrorism, suggesting the attack on a senior minister on Thursday was a one-off event.

Security Minister Wiranto is in hospital recovering from surgery after he was stabbed by a man and a woman at an official event in Banten province, where authorities say Muslim militants have a presence. Police who arrested the couple say they could be linked to Islamic State.

The wounded Wiranto being loaded onto a helicopter after the attack.. AP

Luhut Binsar Panjaitan, Co-ordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and a former security minister, said on Friday the attack would not delay the inauguration of President Joko Widodo, who is due to formally begin his second five-year term at a ceremony on Sunday week.

"President Joko is not afraid. He is not afraid of anything," said the Minister, often referred to as Luhut.

Mr Luhut said he had visited Mr Wiranto in hospital on Friday morning and said that while the security minister was weak, he was well enough to share a joke.
description: The stabbing of the country's security minister will not get in the way of the presidential inauguration, the Indonesian government says.
